questions: Q. 1. Write the chemical name and formula of the compound which is used as an antacid.
Q. 2. Name the acid present in ant sting. [Board Term-I Set (C1), 2010]
Q. 3. Which solution is used to dissolve gold ?
answers: Ans. Aqua-regia (3 parts HCl : 1 parts HNO3)

questions: Q. 4. What happens when egg shell is added to nitric acid ?
answers: Ans. Egg shell is made up of Calcium carbonate. When added to nitric acid it gives effervescence due to the evolution of CO2 gas. 2HNO3 + CaCO3 → 2Ca(NO3)2 + H2O + CO2 1

questions: Q. 5. Fresh milk has a pH of 6. When it changes into curd (Yogurt), will its pH value increases or decreases ? Why ?
answers: Ans. When milk changes into curd, its pH will decrease. Because curd contain acid so H+ increases and thus pH will decrease. (1 mark each)

questions: Q. 6. How will you test a gas which is liberated when HCl acid reacts with an active metal ?
answers: Ans. It liberates H2 gas which burns with a pop sound. 1

questions: Q. 7. Which gas is usually liberated when an acid reacts with a metal ?
Q. 8. When conc. acid is added to water, whether the process is exothermic or endothermic ?
answers: Ans. After adding acid to water, dissociation of acid take place forming hydration of ions. As breaking of bonds, needs some energy to proceed, It is endothermic reaction.

questions: Q. 9. Why does flow of acid rain water into a river make the survival of aquatic life in the river difficult ?
answers: Ans. When pH of rain water is less than 5.6 it is called acid rain. Living organisms can survive only in a narrow range of pH change.

questions: Q. 10. What is the pH of gastric juices released during digestion ?
answers: Ans. The pH of gastric acid is 1.5 to 3.5 in the human Stomach. ACIDS, BASES AND SALTS

questions: Q. 11. Which is a stronger acid, with pH = 5 or with pH = 2 ?
answers: Ans. pH = 2 (lower the pH, stronger the acid).

questions: Q. 12. What is the effect of an increase in concentration of H+ ions ? 1 M HCl or 1 M CH3COOH.
answers: Ans. 1 M HCl has a higher concentration of H+ ions, because when HCl dissolves in water it dissociates completely into ions while CH3COOH is a weak acid and does not dissociate into ions completely.

questions: Q. 13. Why does tooth decay start when the pH of mouth is lower than 5.5 ?
answers: Ans. At lower pH below 5.5, the calcium phosphate of enamel of tooth gets corroded.

questions: Q. 14. How is the concentration of hydronium ions (H3O+) affected, when a solution of an acid is diluted ?
answers: Ans. When a solution of an acid is diluted i.e., water is added to it, the concentration of H3O+ ions per unit volume decreases.
